title: New Hampshire State Income Tax Calculator

formulas.title: Formula (extracted LaTeX)
formulas.latex: \text{Total NH State Income Tax} = \text{NH I\&D Tax} + 0 \cdot \text{Wages}
formulas.raw: \text{Total NH State Income Tax} = \text{NH I\&D Tax} + 0 \cdot \text{Wages}

formulas.title: Formula (extracted LaTeX)
formulas.latex: \text{Effective NH Rate} = \frac{\text{Total NH State Income Tax}}{\max(1,\; \text{Wages} + \text{I\&D Income})}
formulas.raw: \text{Effective NH Rate} = \frac{\text{Total NH State Income Tax}}{\max(1,\; \text{Wages} + \text{I\&D Income})}

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: $$ \text{I\&D Income} = \text{Interest} + \text{Dividends} $$ $$ \text{Taxable I\&D} = \max\left(0, \; \text{I\&D Income} - \text{Exemptions}\right) $$ $$ \text{NH I\&D Tax} = \text{Taxable I\&D} \times r_{\text{year}} $$ $$ \text{Total NH State Income Tax} = \text{NH I\&D Tax} + 0 \cdot \text{Wages} $$ $$ \text{Effective NH Rate} = \frac{\text{Total NH State Income Tax}}{\max(1,\; \text{Wages} + \text{I\&D Income})} $$

variables.meaning: property tax (annual or monthly depending on input)
